citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure housing a coyote was in need of maintenance and/or repair. The gate for the enclosure housing a
coyote is made of a metal tubular frame with chain-linked fencing attached to it. There is also a layer of smaller mesh wire
attached across the bottom section of the gate. The 90-degree metal connector at the lower left side of the gate is broken
so that the metal tube, making up the vertical left frame, is no longer connected to the left side of the horizontal tube
making up the lower gate frame.
Failure to maintain housing facilities in good repair can affect the structural integrity of the enclosures which may lead to
the injury or escape of the animals contained in them. Broken and torn enclosures may also have rough or sharp edges
which can also lead to injury of the animals.
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from
injury and to contain the animals. To be corrected by September 2, 2025.

Two metal water receptacles used in wolf enclosures were not kept clean and sanitary. There are currently ten wolf
enclosures. Each enclosure has water provided by constant drip into either rubber or metal water receptacles. One metal
water receptacle had a build-up of a white to orange, crust-like material that appeared to be a mineral buildup from the
well-water provided to the animals. There were also leaves and algae observed in the water. Another metal water
receptacle also had what appeared to be a mineral buildup on the sides and bottom of the receptacle, as well as an
overgrowth of green algae noted on the surface and bottom of the receptacle.
Water receptacles that are not kept clean and sanitary may contaminate the water, which can have an adverse effect on
the health and well-being of the animals.
All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. To be corrected by August 27, 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The primary enclosure housing a coyote was in need of maintenance and/or repair. The gate for the enclosure housing a 
coyote is made of a metal tubular frame with chain-linked fencing attached to it. There is also a layer of smaller mesh wire 
attached across the bottom section of the gate. The 90-degree metal connector at the lower left side of the gate is broken 
so that the metal tube, making up the vertical left frame, is no longer connected to the left side of the horizontal tube 
making up the lower gate frame. 
 
Failure to maintain housing facilities in good repair can affect the structural integrity of the enclosures which may lead to 
the injury or escape of the animals contained in them. Broken and torn enclosures may also have rough or sharp edges 
which can also lead to injury of the animals. 
 
Outdoor housing facilities shall be structurally sound and shall be maintained in good repair to protect the animals from 
injury and to contain the animals. To be corrected by September 2, 2025. 
3.130 
   
Watering. 
Two metal water receptacles used in wolf enclosures were not kept clean and sanitary. There are currently ten wolf 
enclosures. Each enclosure has water provided by constant drip into either rubber or metal water receptacles. One metal 
water receptacle had a build-up of a white to orange, crust-like material that appeared to be a mineral buildup from the 
well-water provided to the animals. There were also leaves and algae observed in the water. Another metal water 
receptacle also had what appeared to be a mineral buildup on the sides and bottom of the receptacle, as well as an 
overgrowth of green algae noted on the surface and bottom of the receptacle. 
 
Water receptacles that are not kept clean and sanitary may contaminate the water, which can have an adverse effect on 
the health and well-being of the animals. 
 
All water receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary. To be corrected by August 27, 2025.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
 n
